TITLE.P: Power Supply Upgrade and Electrification to the UK Railway Infrastructure Network.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Network Rail Infrastructure Limited is using an alliance contracting arrangement to procure the programme of works relating to power supply upgrades and electrification to the UK railway infrastructure network. The works comprised 2 stage of power supply upgrade along the East Coast Mainline, stage 1 Wood Green to Bawtry and stage 2 Bawtry to Edinburgh and also the electrification of the Transpennine Route (Stalybridge to Colton junction, Hambleton junctions and Selby and branches to Middlesbrough, Scarborough, Hull and Cleethorpes). The contract was awarded on 1.10.2014 to an alliance comprising VolkerFitzpatrick Rail Limited, Siemens PLC and J Murphy & Sons Limited and the estimated total value of the alliance contract awarded is between 500 000 000 GBP and 800 000 000 GBP.

This contract relates to the delivery of a multi-disciplinary programme of works, comprising Overhead Line Electrification, Distribution, Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition, Civils and Signalling and Telecoms. The Power Supply Upgrade comprises 2 stages along the East Coast Main Line, Stage 1 — Wood Green to Bawtry and Stage 2 — Bawtry to Edinburgh and also the Electrification of the Transpennine Route (Stalybridge to Colton Junction, Hambleton Junctions and Selby and branches to Middlesborough Scarborough Hull and Cleethorpes). The overall scope will include the 12kA mitigation, system compatibility, renewals work associated with the power upgrade to the overhead line.

OBJECT_DESCR.EU_PROGR_RELATED: This contract may be subject to European funding in the future.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Further detail is provided in Section VI.3)

The Additional Works have become necessary as a direct consequence of the TPE design development, which requires the overhead line, track alignment and signalling to be designed and installed as 1 system. In order for the works to be delivered across the entire route and to ensure system and project safety, a single point of accountability and liability is required. The route comprises 1 section with clear stakeholder management and a single principal contractor role under CDM regulations, track access must be maximised but controlled to reduce customer impact and design across the route must be integrated to ensure a full system solution, meaning that the works cannot be sub-divided across the route. A change in contractor would generate substantial duplication of costs including for site set up and compounds and Network Rail resources and significant inconvenience in a delayed programme. For these reasons, Network Rail considers that it is entitled to award the Additional Works to the Real Alliance on the basis of Regulation 88(1)(b) of the Utilities Contracts Regulation 2016 (‘UCR 2016’).

The only changes to the original contractual framework (ADA and PAA) to facilitate the 2016 Works are either minor, procedural or administrative in nature or do not otherwise substantially depart from the awarded contract and therefore (individually and cumulatively) are not considered to be substantial within the meaning of the Regulation 88(7) of UCR 2016. These include: removal of provisions for a design consultancy sub-alliance (designers to be appointed by the Alliance Contractors under separate sub-consultancy agreement); ring-fencing the pain/gain mechanism for the 2016 Works from the balance of the original ongoing work-scope; a separate Project Alliance Board and Alliance Leadership Team to manage delivery of the 2016 Works; an allowance for profit on risk contingency within the target prices; and payment of profit on abortive development services under the ADA (which would previously have been paid under the PAA). In order to facilitate these changes the parties will enter into a new mirror ADA and PAA on the same terms but incorporating the changes outlined above. Terminology in the documents will change to reflect terminology in the Network Rail IP model PAA.

INFO_ADD.P: The Real Alliance was formed pursuant to the process advertised through Contract Notice 2012/S105-175716 with a total contract value of 500 000 000 GBP to 800 000 000 GBP. The scope of the contract covers, inter alia, Transpennine Electrification and Power Supply Upgrade (‘the Original Scope’). The works now to be instructed include the Original Scope (from Neville Hill Junction to York and from Micklefield to Selby) but also with additional Capacity and Journey Time Improvements (‘the Additional Works’) anticipated to start in May 2016, completing at the end of 2022. The value including the Additional Works is 500 000 000 GBP to 1 150 000 000 GBP.

This work-scope comprising the Original Scope and the Additional Works (together the ‘2016 Works’) will be undertaken on the terms of the original contractual framework (alliance development agreement (ADA) and project alliance agreement (PAA)) with a number of changes referred to in Section IV.1.1)
Further information is provided in Section IV.1.1)

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The High Court of England and Wales
